note:
第一种情况是，YC初创公司的标准交易规模将从7%的15万美元(融资后估值约为210万美元)降至同等股本的12.5万美元(融资后估值约为179万美元)。这笔交易将继续使用保险箱提供，与可转换票据相比，YC和其他一群人首创的保险箱是一种更简单的投资选择。
有趣的是，该公司总是在其条款中写道，它只会按比例收取下一轮融资规模的4%，这显然低于该公司在融资中购买的7%的所有权。4%的数字是一个上限-在加速器的所有权低于4%的情况下，适用较小的百分比。Y Combinator交易的完整条款可在其网站上查阅。
新协议将适用于2021年冬季加入Y Combinator的初创公司，不包括当前夏季一批的初创公司(估计已经获得资金)。
多年来，YC的交易多种多样。十多年前，当它第一次推出时，它提供了6%的2万美元的条款。
Y Combinator的一位女发言人表示，这一变化符合加速器未来的筹款和预算现实。她说：“经济的未来是不可预测的，我们觉得在这些时期转向更精简的模式是谨慎的。”“就我们而言，我们希望为尽可能多的伟大创始人提供资金-特别是在消费者和商业行为正在发生前所未有的变化的时候；这些变化为初创公司带来了无穷无尽的机会。”通过对我们的标准交易进行修改，我们可以再为多达3000家公司提供资金。“。
在预算之外，至少有几个因素在这里潜在地发挥作用。其一是随时随地增加对工作的使用，这大概可以帮助降低初创公司的一些运营成本，特别是在初创公司的早期(即不需要支付WeWork flex办公桌的费用)。
Y Combinator还将更多资金投资于新兴市场初创企业，考虑到当地市场人才的普遍工资，这些初创企业的发展成本可以大幅降低。
然而，这一削减也是一个迹象，表明在新冠肺炎之后，近年来涌入硅谷的资本洪流已经消退-如果有轻微的话。估值令人沮丧，虽然考虑到后来的风险融资规模，25,000美元并不是一个巨大的损失，但16%的估值缩水与我们最近几周在硅谷看到的其他数字是一致的。
note_en:
The first would see the size of the standard deal for YC startups decline from $150,000 for 7% (roughly a $2.1 million post-money valuation) to $125,000 for the same equity (or roughly a $1.79 million post-money valuation). The deal will continue to be offered using a SAFE, which YC and a group of others pioneered as a simpler investment option compared to convertible notes.
 Interestingly, the firm is always writing into its terms that it will only take pro rata up to 4% of a subsequent round’s size, which is obviously smaller than the 7% ownership that the company is buying in its financing. That 4% number is a ceiling — in cases where the accelerator has less ownership than 4%, the smaller percentage applies. Full terms of  Y Combinator’s    deal are available on its website.
  The new deal will apply to startups who join Y Combinator in the Winter 2021 batch, and doesn’t include startups in the current summer batch (who have already presumably been funded)
 YC’s deal has varied over the years. When it first launched more than a decade ago, it offered terms of $20,000 for 6%.
 A Y Combinator spokeswoman said that the change was in line with the fundraising and budget realties of the accelerator going forward. “The future of the economy is unpredictable, and we feel it is prudent during these times to switch to a leaner model,” she said. “In our case, we want to be set up to fund as many great founders as possible — especially during a time that is creating an unprecedented change to consumer and business behavior; with these changes comes endless opportunities for startups. And with the changes made to our standard deal, we can fund as many as 3000 more companies.”
 Outside of budget, at least a couple of factors are potentially at work here. One is the increased use of  Work From Anywhere, which presumably can help lower some of the running costs of a startup, particularly in its earliest days (i.e. no need to pay for that WeWork flex desk).
  Y Combinator has also invested more of its funds into emerging markets startups, which can have dramatically lower costs of development given prevailing wages for talent in local markets.
 Yet, the cutback is also a sign that the flood of capital entering the Valley in recent years has receded — if ever so slightly — in the wake of COVID-19. Valuations are depressing, and while $25,000 is not a massive loss considering the scale of later venture financings, the 16% valuation haircut is inline with other numbers we have seen in the Valley in recent weeks.
title: YC将削减对未来YC初创企业的投资规模
title_en: YC to cut the size of its investment in future YC startups

随着数百万人寻找重新进入劳动力大军的方法，问题出现了：谁真正受益于重新杀戮技术？
这取决于你怎么看，牛仔风险投资公司的高级合伙人乔梅拉·赫雷拉(Jomayra Herrera)说。对于一个人脉深厚的经理来说，重新招聘看起来与对一个没有那么多筹码的人来说有很大的不同，而且绝大多数人都属于后者。并不是每个人都有一个在谷歌或推特的朋友来帮助他们跳过在线申请，直接联系到决策者。
除了在线直播课程提供的可访问性之外，她还指出了资产和机会之间的区别。
赫雷拉说：“你可以让某人接触到一些东西，但除非他们拥有真正参与其中的工具和结构，否则这不是真正的接触。”换句话说，如果公司不支持培训后的就业安置，那么关于重新招聘的内容又有多大用处。
Herrera说，公司必须给个人提供机会，让他们用实际工作来测试技能，并在职业道路上导航。她的母亲没有上过大学，把英语作为第二语言，正在寻求在线培训。然而，在她可以继续工作之前，她必须克服语言支持、简历创建、求职和其他挑战等障碍。
突然之间，内容感觉就像一种商品，不管它是否有活跃的和社交的学习成分。这也是MOOC(大型在线公开课)感觉如此陈旧的部分原因。
例如，据《纽约时报》报道，Udacity在2018年几乎没有现金，在过去两年里裁员超过一半。现在，和其他科技公司一样，它也面临着使用量激增的问题。
note_en:
As millions look for a way to reenter the workforce, the question arises: Who really benefits from reskilling technology?
 That depends on how you look at it, said  Jomayra Herrera, a senior associate at  Cowboy Ventures. Reskilling for a well-networked manager looks a lot different than it does for someone who doesn’t have as much leverage, and the vast majority of people fall into the latter. Not everyone has a friend at Google or Twitter to help them skip the online application and get right to the decision-makers.
 Beyond the accessibility offered by live online classes, she pointed to the difference between assets and opportunities.
 “You can give someone access to something, but it’s not true access unless they have the tools and structure to really engage with it,” Herrera said. In other words, how useful is content around reskilling if the company doesn’t support job placement post-training.
 Herrera said companies must give individuals opportunities to test skills with real work and navigate the career path. Her mother, who did not go to college and speaks English as a second language, is looking to pursue training online. Before she can proceed, however, she has to surmount hurdles like language support, resume creation, job search and other challenges.
 All of a sudden, content feels like a commodity, regardless of if it has active and social learning components. It’s part of the reason that MOOCs (massive open online courses) feel so stale.
 Udacity, for example, was almost out of cash in 2018 and laid off more than half of its team in the past two years, according to  The New York Times. Now, like other edtech companies, it is facing surges in usage.
title: 谁是真正从重新杀戮中获益的人？

Tatmadaw的一位发言人表示，有关军事行动和阵地的敏感信息泄露，是阿拉坎邦部分地区上周末进入第二个年头的互联网禁令的主要原因之一。
Tatmadaw True News新闻组秘书Zaw Min Tun准将于6月23日在Nay Pyi Taw举行的新闻发布会上发表讲话。
他解释说：“军事信息，比如哪个军事纵队正在从什么位置移动到哪个地区，这些信息都上传到了社交媒体上。”“而且有一些信息让国内外的人误解了鞑靼人。因此，出于安全原因，我们不得不关闭该地区的互联网。“。
佐敏敦称，互联网禁运也是为了阻止极端主义言论、仇恨言论和误导性信息的传播。他说，缅甸政府军目前还没有计划向政府建议解除禁令。
6月21日是七个阿拉坎州乡镇和钦邦帕莱特瓦镇实施互联网封锁一周年。
在过去的一年里，长期剥夺互联网接入的做法招致了很多批评，本周Pyithu Hluttaw议员U Pe Than又进行了抨击。
“在其他国家，互联网没有被关闭，以避免仇恨言论和(泄露)军事事务。如果(在其他国家)采取这样的行动，禁令很快就会解除。我们国家已经实施互联网禁令一年了。这不应该发生，“代表Myebon镇的U Pe Than说。
他建议，政府应该使用其他方法解决问题，并应该解除互联网禁令。
言论自由倡导组织Athan的研究经理Ko Ye Wai表示，民主政府有责任充分保护人民的言论自由权利。
他补充说，对于容易受到潜在人权侵犯的饱受战争蹂躏的人来说，互联网接入是一个重要的问责机制。
“有必要结束互联网禁令。来自受战争影响地区的人们是这场战争的受害者。如果他们没有互联网接入，他们可能面临更大的生命、财产和繁荣损失的风险。居民的主要希望是有互联网接入，“柯业伟说。
2019年6月21日，政府对阿拉坎州的Buthidaung、Maungdaw、Rathedaung、Ponnagyun、Kyauktaw、Myebon、Mrauk-U和Minbya镇以及Paletwa镇实施了互联网禁令。这项禁令于9月1日在一些乡镇解除，但在2月3日重新实施。孟都镇于5月2日第二次恢复互联网接入。
阿拉干和钦邦受影响的八个乡镇仍有100多万人没有互联网接入。
note_en:
A Tatmadaw spokesperson said the leaking of sensitive information about military operations and positions was one of the primary reasons for an internet ban in parts of Arakan State that entered its second year over the weekend.
 The secretary of the Tatmadaw True News Information Team, Brigadier-General Zaw Min Tun, was speaking at a news conference in Nay Pyi Taw on June 23.
 “Military information such as which military column is moving from what location to which area is uploaded on social media,” he explained. “And there is some information that makes people in the country and abroad misunderstand the Tatmadaw. So, we have to shut down the internet in the region for security reasons.”
 Zaw Min Tun described the internet embargo as also intended to put a stop to the dissemination of extremist rhetoric, hate speech and misleading information, saying the Tatmadaw had no plan as yet to recommend a lifting of the ban to the government.
 June 21 marked the one-year anniversary of the internet blackout, imposed in seven Arakan State townships and Chin State’s Paletwa Township.
 The long-running deprivation of internet access has drawn much criticism over the past year, and this week Pyithu Hluttaw lawmaker U Pe Than piled on.
  “In other countries, the internet is not shut down to avoid hate speech and [leaking of] military affairs. If such action is imposed [in other countries], the ban is lifted in short order. Our country has imposed the internet ban for a year. It should not happen,” said U Pe Than, who represents Myebon Township.
 The government should resolve its issues using other approaches and should lift the internet ban, he suggested.
 Ko Ye Wai, research manager of the free speech advocacy group Athan, said a democratic government is responsible for fully protecting people’s right to freedom of expression.
 He added that internet access was an important accountability mechanism for a war-ravaged people vulnerable to potential human rights abuses.
 “It is necessary to end the internet ban. People from war-affected areas are victims of the war. If they do not have internet access, they might face greater risk of losing their lives, property and prosperity. The main hope for the residents is to have internet access,” Ko Ye Wai said.
 The government imposed its internet ban on Buthidaung, Maungdaw, Rathedaung, Ponnagyun, Kyauktaw, Myebon, Mrauk-U and Minbya townships in Arakan State, and Paletwa Township, on June 21, 2019. The ban was lifted in some of the townships on September 1, only to be reimposed on February 3. Maungdaw Township saw its internet access restored for a second time  on May 2.
 More than 1 million people across the eight affected townships in Arakan and Chin states remain without internet access.

苹果系统管理员在宣布收购消息的当天上午开始在社交媒体上抱怨，称公司不再允许他们连接第三方应用程序。
“主要是Fleetsmith维护了一个第三方应用程序目录，这样你就可以在你的Mac上部署Chrome或Zoom之类的东西，Fleetsmith会维护这些应用程序的安全更新。这是我们购买Fleetsmith的主要原因，“一位Fleetsmith客户告诉TechCrunch。
这位客户补充说，该公司在一篇博客文章中将此功能描述为一项主要功能：
Fleetsmith会自动为您处理这一切。一旦强制执行该版本，就会立即在整个设备群中下载并排队等待安装。大多数应用程序在重启后都会自动静默更新，但用户也可以选择手动更新。我们的代理将定期提醒用户更新，一旦实施日期到来，他们将有机会保存工作，然后自行运行更新。
事实证明，苹果在给Fleetsmith客户的一封电子邮件中明确表示，它将在过渡当天停止使用这一功能。这封电子邮件包含了几篇帮助文章的链接，这些文章本应帮助管理员完成过渡。(电子邮件全文包括在文章末尾)。
与我交谈过的管理员的普遍共识是，这些文章没有太大的帮助。虽然他们描述了一种解决问题的方法，但他们表示，苹果已经将原本高度自动化的体验变成了高度手动的体验，有效地消除了一开始就拥有更新功能的速度和易用性优势。
苹果确实证实，在本周的变化之后，它已经对一些帮助票证请求做出了回应，称它将很快恢复目录应用程序的一些配置，并正在根据需要与受影响的客户合作。然而，该公司没有明确说明为什么他们一开始就删除了这一功能。
Fleetsmith提供了几个吸引Mac系统管理员的关键功能。首先，它让他们可以开箱即用地自动设置新的Mac电脑。这允许他们发货新的Mac或其他苹果设备，一旦员工开机并连接到WiFi，它就会连接到Fleetsmith，系统管理员可以在那里跟踪使用情况和更新。此外，它还允许系统管理员在公司设备上强制执行Apple安全和操作系统更新。
更重要的是，它还可以对Google Chrome、Zoom或其他许多第三方应用程序做同样的事情。当这些公司推出新的更新时，系统管理员可以确保所有用户的计算机上都运行了最新版本。这是本周删除的关键功能。
目前尚不清楚苹果为什么选择剥离给客户的电子邮件中概述的这些功能，但除了恢复Catalog应用程序的一些配置外，这些功能中的大部分似乎都不会回来了。
收购当天发给Fleetsmith客户的电子邮件概述了这些变化：
记者试图联系到Fleetsmith创始人请其置评，但均未成功。如果有变化，我们将更新这篇文章。
note_en:
Apple   systems administrators began complaining on social media on the morning of the acquisition announcement that the company was no longer allowing them to connect to third-party applications.
 “Primarily  Fleetsmith   maintained a third party app catalog, so you could deploy things like Chrome or Zoom to your Macs, and Fleetsmith would maintain security updates for those apps. This was the main reason we purchased Fleetsmith,” a Fleetsmith customer told TechCrunch.
  The customer added that the company described this functionality as a major feature in  a company blog post:
 Fleetsmith handles this all for you automatically. Once the version is enforced, it is downloaded and queued for install immediately across the device fleet. Most apps will update silently and automatically once they’re restarted, but users can also choose to do the update manually. Our agent will remind users about the update periodically, and then once the enforcement date hits, it will give them an opportunity to save work and then run the update itself.
  As it turned out, Apple had made it clear that it was discontinuing this feature in an email to Fleetsmith customers on the day of the transition. The email included links to several help articles that were supposed to assist admins with the transition. (The email is included in full at the end of the article).
 The general consensus among admins that I spoke to was that these articles were not terribly helpful. While they described a way to fix the issues, they said that Apple has turned what was a highly automated experience into a highly manual one, effectively eliminating the speed and ease of use advantage of having then update feature in the first place.
 Apple did confirm that it had responded to some help ticket requests after the changes this week, saying that it would soon restore some configurations for Catalog apps, and were working with impacted customers as needed. The company did not make clear, however, why they removed this functionality in the first place.
 Fleetsmith offered a couple of key features that appealed to Mac system administrators. For starters, it let them set up new Macs automatically out of the box. This allows them to ship a new Mac or other Apple device, and as soon as the employee powers it up and connects to WiFi, it connects to Fleetsmith where systems administrators can track usage and updates. In addition, it allowed System Administrators to enforce Apple security and OS updates on company devices.
 What’s more, it could also do the same thing with third-party applications like Google Chrome, Zoom or many others. When these companies pushed a new update, system administrators could make sure all users had the most recent version running on their machines. This is the key functionality that was removed this week.
 It’s not clear why Apple chose to strip out these features outlined in the email to customers, but it seems likely that most of this functionality  isn’t coming back, other than restoring some configurations for Catalog apps.
 Email that went out to Fleetsmith customers the day of the acquisition outlining the changes:
   Attempts to reach Fleetsmith founders for comment were unsuccessful. Should that change we will update the article.
title: Fleetsmith客户对苹果收购后失去第三方应用程序支持感到不满
title_en: Fleetsmith customers unhappy with loss of third-party app support after Apple acquisition

分析表明，英国医院里的冠状病毒患者现在的死亡速度比疫情高峰期要慢。
牛津大学的研究人员发现，在4月至6月期间，英国每天死亡的冠状病毒患者的比例从6%下降到1.5%。
治疗的改进、患者数量的变化和季节性影响都可能起到作用。
在4月8日疫情最严重的时候，英格兰有15468名冠状病毒携带者住院，其中899人死亡(6%)。
根据牛津大学循证医学中心汇编的最新数据，截至6月21日，有2698名冠状病毒患者住院治疗，其中30人死亡(1%)。
医院病死率是自疫情爆发以来使用的一种衡量标准，提供了一致的数字，并使研究人员能够寻找趋势。
虽然住院人数和住院死亡人数都在下降，但死亡人数下降的速度更快。
与新冠肺炎一起住院的人数每29天减少一半，而死亡人数每16天减少一半。
进行这项分析的卡尔·赫内根教授表示，包括意大利在内的其他国家也出现了医院死亡率下降的模式，
如果死亡率是1%而不是6%，这是一种截然不同的疾病。
他说，这意味着在疾病最严重的4月份，每天有500人死亡。
他的合著者杰森·奥克(Jason Oke)说，这是一个令人鼓舞的趋势，但需要更多的工作来理解原因。
尽管研究人员无法确定这一趋势背后的确切原因，但他们提出了一些原因。
其一是，随着对这种疾病的了解越来越多，医护人员已经能够更好地使用现有药物治疗它，即使在新的治疗方法上没有任何重大突破。
例如，医生现在已经准备好期待血液凝固和免疫反应过度的患者，而在早期，他们希望治疗主要被视为呼吸道疾病的症状。
在重症监护患者中，常见的类固醇地塞米松现在被用来抑制可能导致器官损伤的失控免疫反应。
根据赫内根教授的说法，这可能是一个关键因素，但不太可能完全解释死亡率下降的原因。
这也可能归因于住院患者类型的变化。
研究人员表示，随着NHS的压力有所缓解，有可能会有空间接纳那些在疫情高峰期没有达到更严格的医院护理门槛的患者。这些患者可能会稍微不那么脆弱，因此死亡的可能性也更小。
更令人沮丧的是，这种病毒也有可能已经撕裂了最脆弱的人群，留下了一开始风险较低的人。
另一种可能性是，可能有一群患者长期住院，他们既没有出院，也没有死于病毒。
夏天也可能起到保护作用：循环中危害人们免疫系统的其他疾病较少，而更多的阳光意味着更多的维生素D。
note_en:
Coronavirus patients in hospital in England are dying at a slower rate now than they were at the peak of the epidemic, analysis suggests.
 University of Oxford researchers found the proportion of coronavirus patients dying each day in England fell from 6% to 1.5% between April and June.
 Improvements in treatments, changes in the patient population and seasonal effects could all play a role.
  Around the height of the outbreak, on 8 April, there were 15,468 people in hospital in England with coronavirus of whom 899 died (6%).
  By 21 June there were 2,698 hospitalised coronavirus patients, 30 of whom died (1%), according to the most recent data compiled University of Oxford's Centre for Evidence-Based Medicine.
 Hospital case fatality is a measure used since the beginning of the outbreak, providing consistent figures and enabling researchers to look for trends.
  While both the number of people in hospital and the number of hospitalised people dying are falling, deaths are falling at a faster rate.
 The number of people in hospital with Covid-19 is halving every 29 days, while deaths are halving every 16 days.
 Prof Carl Heneghan, who carried out the analysis, said the pattern of falling death rates in hospitals was also being seen in other countries, including Italy,
  "It's a radically different disease we're looking at if the death rate is 1% rather than 6%".
 He said that translated to a difference of 500 deaths a day in April when the disease was at its height.
 "This is an encouraging trend but one that needs more work to understand the cause," his co-author Jason Oke said.
 Although the researchers were unable to determine exactly what was behind the trend, they put forward a number of reasons.
  One is that, as more is understood about the disease, healthcare staff have been better able to treat it using existing drugs, even without any major breakthrough in new treatments.
 For example, doctors are now primed to expect patients with blood clotting and overactive immune responses, whereas in the early days they were looking to treat the symptoms of what was seen as primarily a respiratory disease.
 And in critical care patients, the common steroid  dexamethasone is now being used to dampen down the out-of-control immune reactions that can cause organ damage.
 This is likely to be a key factor, but is unlikely to completely explain the falling death rate, according to Prof Heneghan.
  It may also be down to changes in the types of patients admitted to hospital.
  As strain on the NHS has eased, the researchers say it is possible that there is room to admit patients who would not have met the stricter threshold for hospital care at the height of the epidemic. And these patients may be slightly less vulnerable and therefore less likely to die.
 More sombrely, it's also possible that the virus, having torn through the most vulnerable populations, has left behind people who were at lower risk to start with.
 A further possibility is that there could be a group of patients in hospital for long periods, not being discharged but also not succumbing to the virus.
 Summer might also be playing a protective role: there are fewer other illnesses in circulation to compromise people's immune systems, and more sunlight means more  Vitamin D.
title: 医院冠状病毒死亡率下降
title_en: Coronavirus death rate falling in hospitals

联邦通信委员会(Federal Communications Commission)正在帮助查特避免纽约州的宽带竞争，该决定将阻止政府为查特需要建设的地点的其他ISP提供资金。
FCC计划在定于10月份开始的反向拍卖中，在10年内从农村数字机会基金(RDOF)向ISP奖励高达160亿美元。联邦通信委员会昨天在一份声明中表示，它批准了Charge Communications的豁免请求，将纽约的2127个人口普查区排除在合格地区名单之外，因为根据与纽约州达成的和解协议，该公司将在这些地区部署宽带。
另外，FCC拒绝了边境通信公司(Frontier Communications)提出的将29个州部分地区的近1.7万个人口普查区排除在拍卖之外的请求。
RDOF的规定阻止在已经拥有家庭互联网接入的人口普查区块提供资金，这些地区的下行速度至少为25 Mbps，上行速度至少为3 Mbps。RDOF的规定还阻止在人口普查区提供资金，在这些地区，至少有一家ISP从任何联邦或州宽带补贴计划中获得资金，以提供25/3 Mbps或更好的服务。但正如我们之前报道的那样，该规定不会阻止ISP获得资金，为纽约部分地区提供服务，因为合并条件要求Charge提供服务，但该公司尚未完成建设。查特向联邦通信委员会请愿，要求豁免禁止在那些人口普查区提供RDOF资金，在这些地区，查特没有资金，但仍然有约束力的州义务，必须部署至少25/3 Mbps的宽带服务。
查特在纽约的项目是州政府在收购时代华纳有线电视时强加的条件所要求的。Charge未能在该项目的临时最后期限前完成，但在同意支付1200万美元用于其他新宽带部署的和解协议中，获得了额外一年的遵守时间。根据新的推迟的最后期限，查特需要在2021年9月30日之前完成向纽约州北部的14.5万户家庭和企业部署服务。查特以Spectrum品牌名称提供服务。
联邦通信委员会表示，将纽约人口普查区排除在今年的拍卖之外，将推动委员会的目标，即农村数字机会基金支持流向最需要普遍服务支持的地区，以推进宽带部署-这些地区仍然完全没有宽带服务，宽带速度为25/3 Mbps。
FCC最初将整个纽约排除在拍卖之外，但在抗议后推翻了这一决定。根据昨天的决定，纽约的47,024套住房和企业有资格从今年的拍卖中获得资金。
美国大约有1100万个人口普查区，但有数百万个空置。人口普查局表示，每个人口普查区的大小不等，从四面都是街道的城市中的一个街区到偏远地区数百平方英里的街区。
在同一命令的另一部分中，FCC昨天表示，它将允许在Frontier声称提供25/3 Mbps服务的16987个人口普查区提供资金。FronTier于2020年4月申请破产，当它向FCC声称自2019年6月以来已经在这16,987个人口普查区部署了25/3 Mbps宽带时，招致了质疑。FCC表示，FronTier后来解释说，其16987个人口普查区的名单并没有反映自2019年6月以来的新建筑，而是更准确地报告了某些地区可用的最快速度。
FCC同意有理由持怀疑态度。FCC表示，鉴于记录中对Frontier提交的文件的有效性存在大量而重大的担忧，包括它自己承认错误提交了2019年6月的数据，它试图修改的质疑中存在错误，以及对其质疑的解释不一致，委员会驳回了Frontier的质疑，FCC表示。
Frontier在4月10日的一份文件中敦促FCC将16987个人口普查区排除在外。但一个半月后，Frontier放弃了这一请求，在5月23日告诉FCC，它欢迎将Frontier以25/3 Mbps或更高速度提供服务的受到挑战的人口普查区纳入RDOF拍卖。这些人口普查区分布在29个州；自最初提交申请以来，Frontier完成了在其中4个州的业务出售。
FCC说，在全国范围内，它确定5392,530个住宅和企业被算作未提供服务的地点，今年160亿美元的拍卖可以在这些地点分配资金。RDOF的总体预算是在10年内达到204亿美元。剩下的44亿美元将在FCC收集到更准确的宽带地图数据后分配。

note_en:
The Federal Communications Commission is helping Charter avoid broadband competition in New York State with a decision that will block government funding for other ISPs in locations where Charter is required to build.
 The FCC plans to award ISPs up to $16 billion over 10 years from the Rural Digital Opportunity Fund (RDOF) in a reverse auction  scheduled to begin in October. The FCC said in an  announcement yesterday that it "granted Charter Communications' waiver request to exclude 2,127 census blocks in New York from the eligible areas list because the company will deploy broadband in those locations pursuant to a settlement reached with the State of New York."
 Separately, the FCC denied a Frontier Communications request to exclude nearly 17,000 census blocks in parts of 29 states from the auction.
 RDOF rules block funding in census blocks that already have home-Internet access at speeds of at least 25Mbps downstream and 3Mbps upstream. RDOF rules also block funding in census blocks where at least one ISP has been awarded money from any federal or state broadband-subsidy program "to provide 25/3Mbps or better service." But as we  previously reported, that rule would not prevent ISPs from getting funding to serve parts of New York where  Charter is required by a merger condition to offer service but in which it hasn't yet finished construction. Charter petitioned the FCC for a waiver to ban RDOF funding in those census blocks "in which Charter has unfunded but nonetheless binding state obligations to deploy at least 25/3Mbps broadband service."
 Charter's New York project is required by conditions the state government imposed on its purchase of Time Warner Cable. Charter failed to meet interim deadlines in that project but got an extra year to comply in a settlement in which it  agreed to pay $12 million toward other new broadband deployments. Under the new, postponed deadline, Charter is required to finish deploying service to 145,000 homes and businesses in Upstate New York by September 30, 2021. Charter offers service under the Spectrum brand name.
 The FCC said excluding the New York census blocks from this year's auction "will further the Commission's goal that Rural Digital Opportunity Fund support flow to areas that are in the most need of universal service support to advance broadband deployment—those that remain wholly unserved with broadband speeds of 25/3Mbps."
 The FCC originally  shut all of New York out of the auction, but it reversed that decision after protest. Under yesterday's decision, 47,024 homes and businesses in New York are eligible for funding from this year's auction.
 There are about 11 million census blocks in the US, but several million are  unoccupied. The size of each census block varies from "a block in a city bounded on all sides by streets" to "hundreds of square miles" in remote areas, the Census Bureau  says.
  In another portion of the same order, the FCC yesterday said it will allow funding in 16,987 census blocks where Frontier  claimed it offers 25/3Mbps service. Frontier, which filed for bankruptcy in April 2020, drew skepticism when it claimed to the FCC that it had deployed 25/3Mbps broadband to those 16,987 census blocks since June 2019. Frontier later "explained that its list of 16,987 census blocks does not reflect new builds since June 2019, but rather more accurate reporting on the fastest speeds that are available in certain blocks," the FCC said.
 The FCC agreed there is reason for skepticism. "Given the numerous and significant concerns in the record regarding the validity of Frontier's filing, including its own admission that it had misfiled its June 2019 data, errors in its challenge that it sought to revise, and inconsistent explanations for its challenge, the commission denied Frontier's challenge," the FCC said.
 Frontier urged the FCC to exclude the 16,987 census blocks in a  filing on April 10. But Frontier gave up on that request a month and a half later,  telling the FCC on May 23 that it "would welcome the inclusion into the RDOF auction the challenged census blocks where Frontier provides service at speeds of 25/3Mbps and greater." These census blocks are in 29 states; since the original filing,  Frontier completed a sale of its operations in four of those states.
 Nationwide, the FCC said it determined that 5,392,530 homes and businesses count as "unserved locations" where this year's $16 billion auction can distribute funding. The RDOF's overall budget is $20.4 billion over 10 years. The remaining $4.4 billion will be distributed after the FCC  collects more accurate broadband-mapping data.
 Disclosure: The Advance/Newhouse Partnership, which owns 13 percent of Charter, is part of Advance Publications. Advance Publications owns Condé Nast, which owns Ars Technica.
title: FCC帮助Charge避免宽带竞争
title_en: FCC helps Charter avoid broadband competition

市中心-珍妮·李(Jenny Lee)在一家艺术教育非营利组织工作，这让她在西区和南区的学校上学。当她需要乘坐优步或Lyft去上班时，它们“相当昂贵”，即使是短途旅行也要花费20-30美元。
相比之下，她说，这种离她住的地方更近的湖景东区的旅行“永远只需要12美元”。
李说：“尽管我的工作支付了这些费用，但我们是非营利性的，我们没有无限的预算。”“很多时候，当我必须去某个地方的时候，我觉得这对于我实际要走的路程来说可能太多了。”
最近的一项研究表明，李的经历可能是优步和Lyft对在芝加哥以非白人为主的社区下车的乘客收取更高价格的更大模式的一部分。
乔治华盛顿大学(George Washington University)的两名研究人员进行的这项研究显示，芝加哥的叫车费用每英里都会上涨，因为某人在非白人居民比例较高的社区下车。
研究人员阿克沙特·潘迪(Akshat Pandey)和艾林·卡利斯坎(Aylin Caliskan)表示，他们的研究发现，动态定价模式-拼车服务使用的是动态定价模式，而出租车不使用-被发现会导致“基于种族的价格差异”。
研究还得出结论，如果乘客在居民年龄偏小或大多数居民没有获得大学学位的社区上下车，他们的票价可能会发生变化。根据这项研究，人们在房价较高的地区接送时也会收取更高的费用。
两人表示，他们的研究是对用于确定叫车应用定价的算法进行的第一次“大规模公平”审查。
根据这项研究，芝加哥之所以被选为研究对象，是因为它有法律要求拼车公司披露票价。芝加哥的优步(Uber)和Lyft打车服务是美国最昂贵的打车服务之一，这要归功于该市某些地区对单次乘车征收的新税。
这项研究使用了美国人口普查数据和2018年11月至2019年12月期间芝加哥1亿多次叫车出行的数据。
伊利诺伊大学芝加哥分校(University Of Illinois At Chicago)城市规划学副教授凯特·洛(Kate Lowe)表示，在该市的地理位置上，种族可能会在优步和Lyft的定价中发挥作用，她对此并不感到惊讶。
研究交通的洛威表示，叫车应用在扩大非白人社区和低收入家庭居民的准入方面可以发挥重要作用。
她说：“这项研究显示的结果与社会科学领域的许多人的发现一致，即在一个以结构性种族主义为特征的世界里，市场机制往往会反映和强化结构性种族主义。”
优步的一位发言人表示，公司不会容忍通过算法或用户进行的歧视，并赞扬了研究动态定价影响的研究。
尽管如此，这位发言人表示，这项研究在分析中可能忽略了许多其他因素。
该公司的声明写道：“重要的是，不要等同于因果关系，这一分析可能没有考虑到一些相关因素，比如与土地使用/邻里模式、出行目的、一天中的时间和其他影响的相关性。”“我们期待看到最终结果.”
Lyft的一位发言人对最近在沙龙发表的一篇关于这项研究的文章做出了类似的回应，称这项分析“存在严重缺陷”，其动态定价没有考虑种族因素。
作者在给芝加哥街区俱乐部的一份声明中说，这项研究表明“价格歧视与上下车地点的人口统计数据高度相关。”
研究人员说：“这些发现不能提供对因果关系的直接洞察力，但精确地量化了无意中的不同影响，这些影响使居住在特定社区的历史上处于不利地位的群体处于进一步的不利地位。”
以前也研究过同样的定价模型。这项研究指出，2015年的一项分析显示，备考公司普林斯顿评论(Princeton Review)在亚裔美国人较多的地区向个人收取了更高的价格。
订阅芝加哥街区俱乐部。我们每一分钱都能从芝加哥的社区报道。
note_en:
DOWNTOWN — Jenny Lee works for an arts education nonprofit, which takes her to schools in the West and South sides. When she needs to take an Uber or Lyft for work, they are “quite expensive,” costing $20-$30 even for short trips.
 By contrast, such trips closer to where she lives in Lakeview East are “only ever 12 bucks,” she said.
 “Even though my work pays for these, we’re a nonprofit and we don’t have an unlimited budget,” Lee said. “So often times, when I have to go somewhere, it feels like this is maybe way too much for how far I’m actually going.”
 A recent  study shows Lee’s experience may be part of a larger pattern of Uber and Lyft charging higher prices for riders being dropped off in predominately non-white neighborhoods of Chicago.
 The study, from two researchers at George Washington University, showed ride-hailing fares in Chicago increased per mile for trips where a person was dropped off in a neighborhood with a high percentage of non-white residents.
 Researchers Akshat Pandey and Aylin Caliskan said their study found dynamic pricing models — used by ride sharing services but not taxis — have been found to lead to “racially-based price disparities.”
 The study also concludes riders may see their fares change if they’re picked up or dropped off in neighborhoods where residents skew younger or where most residents haven’t obtained a college degree. People are also being charged more when getting picked up in areas with more expensive homes, according to the study.
  The two said their study is the first “large-scale fairness” review of algorithms used to determine the prices set by ride-hailing apps.
 Chicago was chosen for the research because it has laws that ask ride-share companies to  disclose their fare prices, according to the study. Uber and Lyft rides in Chicago are among the  most expensive in the country, thanks to  new taxes on single rides in certain areas of the city.
 The study used U.S. Census data and data from more than 100 million ride-hailing trips in Chicago between November 2018 to December 2019.
 Kate Lowe, an associate professor of urban planning at University of Illinois at Chicago, said she was not surprised about the role race may play in the pricing of Ubers and Lyfts within the city’s geography.
 Lowe, who studies transportation, said ride-hailing apps can have an important role in expanding access for residents of non-white neighborhoods and low-income households.
 “What this study shows aligns with what many people across social sciences find, which is — in a world characterized by structural racism — market mechanisms are often going to reflect and reinforce structural racism,” she said.
 An Uber spokesperson said the company does not condone discrimination through algorithms or users and praised studies researching the impact of dynamic pricing.
 Still, the spokesperson said the study may have overlooked numerous other factors in its analysis.
 “It’s important not to equate correlation for causation, and there may be a number of relevant factors that weren’t taken into account for this analysis, such as correlations with land-use/neighborhood patterns, trip purposes, time of day, and other effects,” the company statement read. “We look forward to seeing the final results.”
 A Lyft spokesperson responded similarly to a recent article about the study in  Salon, saying the analysis was “deeply flawed” and race did not factor into its dynamic pricing.
 The authors said in a statement to Block Club Chicago the study demonstrates “price discrimination correlates highly with the demographics of pickup and dropoff locations.”
 “These findings cannot provide direct insights on causality, yet precisely quantify the unintentional disparate impact that puts historically disadvantaged groups residing at particular neighborhoods at a further disadvantage,” the researchers said.
 This same pricing model has been researched before. The study points to  a 2015 analysis that showed The Princeton Review, a test prep company, charged higher prices to individuals in areas with more Asian Americans.

title_en: Uber, Lyft Charge More for Riders Going to Non-White Neighborhoods, Study Shows

联合利华长期以来一直站在不断变化的数字供应链中提供行业领先地位，无论是在可看性、测量、广告欺诈还是品牌安全方面，我们一直在不断发展我们的方法，通过联合利华责任框架解决社会问题，该框架呼吁更负责任的平台、内容和基础设施。
通过这一框架，我们正在积极与所有数字平台接触，以做出有意义的改变，并影响信任和透明度。我们已经取得了实质性进展，我们承认我们合作伙伴的努力，但仍有更多工作要做，特别是在美国这一两极分化的选举期间，在分裂和仇恨言论领域。
当前文化格局的复杂性赋予了品牌新的责任，要求它们学习、回应并采取行动，以推动一个值得信赖和安全的数字生态系统。
鉴于我们的责任框架和美国两极分化的氛围，我们决定从现在开始至少到今年年底，我们将不会在美国的社交媒体新闻馈送平台Facebook、Instagram和Twitter上投放品牌广告。目前继续在这些平台上投放广告不会给人们和社会增加价值。我们将持续监测，并将在必要时重新考虑我们目前的立场。
我们将通过转向其他媒体来维持我们在美国的媒体投资总额。
我们将继续与我们的合作伙伴单独合作，并通过所有行业论坛，如全国广告商协会(ANA)、世界广告商联合会(WFA)、全球负责任媒体联盟(GARM)等，推动行动、透明度、澄清政策并创造执法的一致性。我们相信，这种做法将带来更富有成效的进展。
note_en:
Unilever has long been at the forefront of providing industry leadership within a changing digital supply chain, whether it be viewability, measurement, ad fraud or brand safety and we’ve continued to evolve our approach to address societal issues with the Unilever Responsibility Framework that calls for more responsible platforms, content and infrastructure.
 Through this framework, we are actively engaging with all digital platforms to make meaningful change and impact trust and transparency. We have made substantial progress, and we acknowledge the efforts of our partners, but there is much more to be done, especially in the areas of divisiveness and hate speech during this polarized election period in the U.S.
 The complexities of the current cultural landscape have placed a renewed responsibility on brands to learn, respond and act to drive a trusted and safe digital ecosystem.
 Given our Responsibility Framework and the polarized atmosphere in the U.S., we have decided that starting now through at least the end of the year, we will not run brand advertising in social media newsfeed platforms Facebook, Instagram and Twitter in the U.S. Continuing to advertise on these platforms at this time would not add value to people and society. We will be monitoring ongoing and will revisit our current position if necessary.
  We will maintain our total planned media investment in the U.S. by shifting to other media.
 We will continue to work with our partners individually and through all industry forums such as the Association of National Advertisers (ANA), World Federation of Advertisers (WFA), Global Alliance for Responsible Media (GARM), among others, to drive action, transparency, clarify policies and create consistency in enforcement. We are confident this approach will lead to more productive progress.
title: 在这个两极分化的时代推动负责任的数字生态系统
title_en: Driving a Responsible Digital Ecosystem in These Polarized Times

在最近的一次筹款活动中，我们对我们的标准交易进行了两次修改。从2021年冬季一批开始，我们的交易将是12.5万美元，购买后资金保险箱7%的股权，我们将在随后的几轮交易中将按比例分配的权利金额减少到4%。在接下来的几年里，这将使我们能够再为多达3000家公司提供资金。
作为背景，YC最初出价约2万美元收购了一家公司6%的股份。2011年，尤里·米尔纳(Yuri Milner)和SV Angel开始向YC的每一家初创公司额外提供15万美元。我们继续与新投资者进行这一计划，并将交易金额降至约10万美元，利率为7%。2014年，我们将这一数字增加到12万美元，2018年，我们筹集了最后一笔资金，增加到15万美元。
多年来，我们已经几次改变了我们的交易，因为我们筹集了新的资金，修改了预算，并与当前的环境和经济相匹配。我们预计这不会是我们最后一次更改交易，但我们确实觉得这是未来几年的正确地点。
note_en:
We are making two changes to our standard deal in conjunction with a recent fundraise. Starting with the Winter 2021 batch, our deal will be $125,000 for 7% equity on a post-money safe, and we will reduce the amount of our  pro rata right to 4% of subsequent rounds. In the coming years, this will enable us to fund as many as 3000 more companies.
 For background, YC originally gave about $20,000 for 6% of a company. In 2011, Yuri Milner and SV Angel began offering an additional $150k to every startup in YC. We continued this program with new investors and reduced the deal to about $100k for 7%. In 2014, we increased that amount to $120k and in 2018 to $150k when we raised our last fund.
 We have changed our deal several times over the years as we have raised new funds, modified budgets, and to match the current environment and economy. We do not expect this to be the last time we change the deal, but we do feel this is the right place to be for the next several years.
title: 新的标准交易

When working on a website or a service, the development environment should imitate as much as possible the production one. And since most production websites and services are served on HTTPS, the same should happen for the development versions as well. This is exactly what  mkcert is trying to solve.
  mkcert is a tool that makes it easy to generate locally-trusted SSL certificates signed by a local CA (Certificate Authority).
    # Install on macOSbrew  install mkcert # Generate and install a local CAmkcert  -install # Create a new certificatemkcert  -key-file key.pem  -cert-file cert.pem localhost
